Hello Rich - 

I've put this photo into my nihontostudy Yahoo folder which this link should take you to. http://tinyurl.com/jcd9k

Photo is labeled: Tsuba 147/22a

Ron

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Richard Turner 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, July 04, 2006 5:41 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba...kantei?


  Ron, can you post the pic elsewhere for those of us who are not in the 
  Nihonto group.

  cheers

  Rich

  Ron Hartmann wrote:
  >
  > Happy 4th everyone!
  >
  > I've just posted a photo in my Yahoo Photos folder (Ron STL) -- Tsuba 
  > 147.22 -- which I'd enjoy some opinions on. It is iron with brass 
  > inlay, kiku design, measures 86 x 84 x 4 mm in size. Inlay represents 
  > mostly leaves with a few flowers. The inlaywork overlaps onto the edge 
  > of the tsuba. Inlay is about 90% intact on face, 50% intact on 
  > backside. Notice there are no hitsu-ana present.
  >
  > http://tinyurl.com/mhf6d <http://tinyurl.com/mhf6d>
  >
  > This tsuba seems too elaborately inlaid to be called Kyo-zogan and I'm 
  > curious if perhaps it might fall more into Yoshiro work. Comments 
  > anyone???
  >
  > Ron
  > STL
